pageContext.analysis: This was a claim once made by a Republican opponent of the former Newark mayor. But a local news report said that "city residents said they recalled seeing the mayor around the neighborhood, including jogging in the early morning hours and buying ice cream for children at a corner grocery store." The article quoted a Booker spokesman Kevin Griffis as denying the claim: "Cory Booker has lived for 16 years in some of Newark's toughest neighborhoods, including for seven years on Hawthorne Avenue, fighting every day to make the city a better place for its residents."
